clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Nonsteroidal Antiinflammatory (NSAI)Drug and Glucocorticoids in Acute Sciatica
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Nonsteroidal Antiinflammatory Drug and Glucocorticoids in Acute Sciatica

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether anti-inflammatory drugs or glucocorticoids are effective in the treatment of acute sciatica

primary_outcome.measure: Mean visual analogue scale (VAS) for leg pain (radicular pain) in 3 groups
primary_outcome.description: VAS is measured in millimiters (0 to 100). This pain score is recommended in rheumatologic units in France.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean visual analogue scale (VAS) for back pain in 3 groups
secondary_outcome.description: VAS is measured in millimeters (0 to 100).
Drug compliance is estimated based on the proportion of the treatment actually administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of treatment on the EIFEL Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 1 and 3 months after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The EIFEL questionnaire is the translation of the Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire (RMDQ) and has been validated in acute low back pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Lasegue's sign compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, Day 1,2,3,4 and 5 of study period
secondary_outcome.description: Lasegue's sign is the lumbar pain experienced by the patient on passive movement of the legs during flexion of hip joint i.e. passive straight leg raising. It is assessed as either 'Positive' or 'Negative' sign.
Schober's test is a test used in rheumatology to measure the ability of patient to flex their lower back

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, day 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 and day 5, 1 and 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Analgesic consumption between active treatment group and placebo group was registered and differences between groups were calculated and presented as percentual differences.
Number of patient having surgery and/or lumbar epidural injection during study period

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical tolerance: adverse events and/or high blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of adverse events and/or high blood pressure between intervention group.
measures of leukocytes, erythrocytes, hemoglobin, platelets, serum sodium, potassium, glucose, plasma creatinine between intervention group
monitoring of glycemic status is measured for each day of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days of hospitalisation sick leave, number of days lost to illness
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the cost of sciatica for society

arm_group.description: administration of 60 mg of methylprednisolone at 8:00 am and 100 ml of 0.9 % sodium chloride (placebo) at 6:00 pm
administration of 100 mg of ketoprofen at 8:00 am and at 6:00 pm
administration of 100 ml of 0.9% sodium chloride (placebo) at 8:00 am and at 6:00 pm
